answers.answer: No, at this time there is no cure.

"it there medicine to cure hepa b?"We patients with HBV all have asked the same question, but maybe that is the wrong question to ask.  Maybe what we should ask is,"what should we do to cure our chronic condition?"Like diabetes, obesity, high blood pressure, high cholestral, heart condition, etc. CHB is a chronic condition and cannot be cured by simply popping a pill in our mouth.  Our doctors know this but all they can do is to follow the guideline and give us pills.  Why?First, in medical schools, they learn how to treat, not how to prevent.  There is not a "how to live and eat healthy" course 101 for them.  Otherwise, our doctors would be immune to all these chronic conditions.  How many of us have not seen at least a round doctor whose white coat buttons are just about to pop?Second, how many of us patients are willing to change our life styles even when advised by our doctors?--Ah, the budweiser is so cool, even though down the road my liver may show elevated ALT;--Boy, that ball game is so exciting, it would be unloyal to my team if I do not stay up past my bedtime and yeal at my TV screen, only one night, surely my liver can take it;--Oh, these junk foods are so delicious and they save me time, my liver is built to detoxfy the greese, preservatives, and all the unrecognizable chemicals added to the foods;--Sweet love, we just have to have it tonight, even though excessive sex is not good even to the healthy, I am special: I am a CHBer and I have our love to keep burning!......
